title: Quiz 3 - Percentage
instruction: In the given questions some values are missing and you are provided with three choices. You have to find which values match with the given choices.

quiz.text: If the value of [D] is 9824 which is 576 less than [C], find the total number of bags manufactured by company Q.
options: 28400
24000
25600
30000
None of these

quiz.text: For company P, if the value of [A] % is 72%, then the total number of mid-range bags is approximately how much percent of that of heavy range bags?
options: 135%
138%
131%
132.5%
140%

quiz.text: If the value of E is (600/11) %, then, find the difference between the total number of midrange bags manufactured by company R and the number of mid-range office bags manufactured by company T.
options: 3744
3474
3764
3677
None of these

quiz.text: For company T, if the number of heavy range bags sold by the company is 250% of mid-range sports bags and the number of heavy range unsold bags is 8736 less than that of sold bags. Find the total number of bags manufactured by the company.
options: 28800
19200
25600
12800
None of these

quiz.text: For company S, if the ratio of the value of [F] % and [G] % is 144:125 respectively and the value of [F]% is 64%, find the number of heavy range sports bags manufactured, if the difference between the number of mid-range bags and heavy range bags is 4800.
options: 3880
3680
3480
3840
None of these

quiz.text: Find the total number of candidates who appeared for shift – 1 from both days?
options: 1705
1650
1695
1785
1675

quiz.text: Find the ratio of male candidates from shift -2 on November 20 to number of female candidates from shift – 3 on November 27?
options: 15:19
14:17
17:13
15:17
None of the above

quiz.text: The total number of candidates from shift – 3 on November 20 is what percentage more/less than shift -3 on November 27? (approximately)
options: 22.5%
20.5%
19.5%
17.5%
None of these

quiz.text: Find the average number of males from all shifts together on November 27?
options: 245
230
285
225
240

quiz.text: If 60% of the number of male candidates from shift 1 on November 20 cleared the exam, then the number of unsuccessful candidates from shift -1 on November 20 is what percentage of number of female students appeared in shift – 3 on November 20?
options: 84%
77%
85%
75%
72%

quiz.text:
Quantity I: In Shahadara, 40% of total graduates are preparing for Bank exams, the number of graduate boys is 50% more than that of girls. If the total number of graduates is 480, and 37.5% of graduate boys are preparing for Bank exams, then find the number of female graduates who are not preparing for Bank exams.

 

Quantity II: A toy is in the shape of a solid cylinder and is melted in ‘n’ number of conical toys. Height of each conical toy is 75% as that of a cylindrical toy and the area of the base of the cylindrical toy is 1500% more than that of each conical toy. Find the value of (200% of (n – 20)).

Use π = 3
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Income of P is Rs. 15600 less than Q, while expenditure of Q is 7500 more than that of P. find savings of R whose savings is 3% of the difference between savings of P and Q. (only numerical value)

 

Quantity II: This year, the cost of a Tomato increased by 20% over that of the last year. Last year a Tomato costed Rs.10 and a Potato costed Rs.5. This year it costs Rs.11 more to buy 5 Potato and 3 Tomato. If the percentage increase in the price of the Potato is . Then find the value of .
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Kolkata consisting of three localities Salt Lake, South Kolkata and Rajarhat the population of the three localities Salt Lake, South Kolkata and Rajarhat are in the ratio 9 : 8 : 3. In Salt Lake, 80% of the people are literate, in South Kolkata, 30% of the people are illiterate. If 90% people in Rajarhat are literate. Find the percentage literacy in these three localities in Kolkata.

 

Quantity II: Class A has boys to girls in the ratio 2 : 3, Class B has girls to boys in the ratio 5 : 3. If the number of students in Class A is at least twice as many as the number of students in Class B, what is the minimum percentage of boys when both classes are considered together?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: In the beginning of 2017, the population of three cities - Bangalore, Chennai and Delhi was in the ratio of 4 : 5 : 6 respectively. During the year 2017, the population of the respective cities was increased by the percentage in the ratio of 7 : 5 : 9. In the beginning of 2018, the population of Delhi was 27000 more than that of the beginning of 2017 and in the beginning of the year 2018 the ratio of the population of Bangalore to Chennai was 108: 125 then during the year 2017, what was the sum of the increase in the population of all the cities together?

 

Quantity II: ln an election of 3 candidates , Narendra Modi, Rahul Gandhi and Arvind Kejriwal. Narendra Modi gets 40% more votes than Rahul Gandhi . Narendra Modi also beats Arvind Kejriwal by 54000 votes. If it is known that Rahul Gandhi gets 10% more votes than Arvind Kejriwal, find the number of voters on the voting list (given 91% of the voters on the voting list voted and no votes were illegal)
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: If the number of students took a test T more than once, how many students took the test?   Statement I: Average marks of the class is 55.8 marks. Statement II: Average Score of the top 40% of students is 75 which are 37 more than the average score of the last 40% of students. Statement III: If only students who are in the top 60% would have appeared such that the top 40% scored average marks of 80, while the remaining top 20% had scored average 60 marks, average marks of the class would be 73.33.
options: I and II are sufficient
Only III is sufficient
Either I and II or III are sufficient
I, II and III are sufficient
Can’t be determined

quiz.text:
How many students from IIT Dhanbad got the placement? 

 

Statement I : Number of students studying in IIT Dhanbad and IIT Kanpur are in the ratio of 3 : 4 respectively and 80% of the students studying in IIT Kanpur got placement.

Statement II : Number of students who got placement from IIT Kanpur is 120% of the number of students who got placement from IIT Dhanbad.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
If the data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Varun’s income is how much more than Rohan’s income?

 

Statement I : Varun’s income is 30% less than his wife, whose provident fund deduction is Rs. 975 per month which is 5% of her monthly income.

Statement II : Rohan spends 30% of his income on house rent, 15% of which is accessory bill and Varun’s expenditure on house rent is Rs. 4500 more than that of Rohan’s.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
If the data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Class B has 50% more students than class A. Number of girls in class A is equal to number of boys in class B. The percentage of girls is the same in both classes. If the percentage of the student group that are boys is equal to , then which among the following statement(s) is/are true?

I:  is a perfect square

II:  is a prime number

III:  is a multiple of 17
options: Only I
Only III
Both I and II
Both I and III
None of the ab

quiz.text: Arjun kapoor and Anil Kapoor appear for a test. For each correct answer is awarded 1 mark and for each wrong answer 1/2 mark is deducted. Arjun kapoor answers some questions and gets 10% of his answers wrong. He secures a score of 85% which is 6 marks more than the pass marks. Anil Kapoor also answers some questions and gets 20% of his answers wrong. He gets a score of 70% which is 3 marks less than the pass mark. No marks are awarded or deducted for the unanswered questions. If the passing marks is a. Then which of the following statement(s) is/are true? I:  is a perfect square II: III:  is not a perfect square
options: Only I
Only II
Both II and III
All I, II and III
Both I and III

quiz.text:
A man distributes 10%, 18% and 22% of his salary into his three children who spend 40%, 60% and 25% of that amount respectively. The difference between the total amount left with the children and man is Rs. 1015. If the salary of the man is a, then which of the following statement(s) is/are true?

I:

II:  is less than 1800

III:
options: Only II
Only I
Both I and II
Only III
Both I and III

quiz.text: In a village, two contestants (A & B) are contesting in an election. 70% of the registered voters cast their votes in the election and A wins the election by 400 votes. If A had received 12.5% less votes, A’s votes would have been equal to B’s votes. If the registered voters in the village are . Then which of the following statement(s) is/are true? I:  is a prime number II:  is a perfect square III:  is more than 60
options: Only I
Only III
Both II and III
Both I and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: Fresh sugarcane contains ___% water and dried sugarcane contains 28% water. ____ kilograms of dried sugarcane can be obtained from 90 kg of fresh sugarcane? I: 84, 20 II: 76, 30 III: 70, 38.5
options: Only I
Only II
Only III
Both I and II
Both I and III

quiz.text: The price of rice has increased by ___%. Lalu has decided to spend only 8% more than what he initially did on buying rice. ___ is the percentage decrease in Lalu's rice consumption? I: 8, 10 II: 20, 10 III: 15, 15
options: Only I
Only II
Only III
Both II and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: A person had a certain amount. He invested ___th of it in shares, 5% of it in mutual funds, 10% of it in debentures and kept the remaining Rs. 850 with him. If got interest at 10% for a year on debentures, __ amount did he get as interest? I: , 510 II:  , 61 III:  , 170
options: Only I
Only II
Both I and III
Both II and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: The ratio of marks obtained by Shubham in theory to the total marks which can be obtained in theory is 7 : 10. Total marks which can be obtained in practical’s were ___% of the total marks of theory. If Shubham got full marks in practical then ___ is the ratio of total marks obtained by Shubham to the total marks which can be obtained in the subject (theory + practical). I: 20, 3:4 II: 30, 5:7 III: 40, 11:14
options: Only I
Both I and II
Both I and III
Only II
All I, II and III
